Methods

AddFallbackFont(Font, Font)

Add a fallback font

public static bool AddFallbackFont(Font font, Font fallback)

Parameters

font Font

The Font to modify.

fallback Font

The Font to add as a fallback

Returns

bool

Returns true on success or false on failure; call GetError() for more information.

Remarks

Add a font that will be used for glyphs that are not in the current font. The fallback font should have the same size and style as the current font.

If there are multiple fallback fonts, they are used in the order added.

This updates any Font objects using this Font.

This function should be called on the thread that created both fonts.

This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0.

See Also
ClearFallbackFonts(Font)
RemoveFallbackFont(Font, Font)

AppendTextString(Text, string)

Append UTF-8 text to a text object.

public static bool AppendTextString(Text text, string str)

Parameters

text Text

The Text to modify.

str string

The UTF-8 text to insert.

Returns

bool

Returns true on success or false on failure; call GetError() for more information.

Remarks

This function may cause the internal text representation to be rebuilt.

This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0.

See Also
DeleteTextString(Text, int, int)
InsertTextString(Text, int, string)
SetTextString(Text, string, ulong)

AppendTextString(Text, string, ulong)

Append UTF-8 text to a text object.

public static bool AppendTextString(Text text, string str, ulong length)

Parameters

text Text

The Text to modify.

str string

The UTF-8 text to insert.

length ulong

The length of the text, in bytes, or 0 for null terminated text.

Returns

bool

Returns true on success or false on failure; call GetError() for more information.

Remarks

This function may cause the internal text representation to be rebuilt.

This function should be called on the thread that created both fonts.

This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0.

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Throws if the Text handle is null or 0x0.

See Also
DeleteTextString(Text, int, int)
InsertTextString(Text, int, string)
SetTextString(Text, string, ulong)

ClearFallbackFonts(Font)

Remove all fallback fonts.

public static void ClearFallbackFonts(Font font)

Parameters

font Font

The Font to modify.

Remarks

This updates any Font objects using this Font.

This function shold be called on the thread that created the Font

This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0.

See Also
AddFallbackFont(Font, Font)
RemoveFallbackFont(Font, Font)

CloseFont(Font)

Dispose of a previously-created Font

public static void CloseFont(Font font)

Parameters

font Font

The Font to dispose of.

Remarks

Call this when done with a Font. This function will free any resources associated with it. It is safe to call this function on null, for example on the result of a failed call to OpenFont(string, float).

The Font is not valid after being passed to this function. String pointers from functions that return information on this font, such as GetFontFamilyName(Font) and GetFontStyleName(Font) are no longer valid after this call, as well.

This function should not be called while any other thread is using the Font.

This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0.

See Also
OpenFont(string, float)
OpenFontIO(IOStream, bool, float)

CopyFont(Font)

Create a copy of an existing Font

public static Font CopyFont(Font existingFont)

Parameters

existingFont Font

The Font to copy.

Returns

Font

Returns a valid Font, or null on failure; call GetError() for more information.

Remarks

The copy will be distinct from the original, but will share the font file and have the same size and style as the original.

When done with the returned Font, use CloseFont(Font) to dispose of it.

This function should be called on the thread that created the original Font.

This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0

See Also
CloseFont(Font)

CreateGPUTextEngine(nint)

Create a text engine for drawing text with the SDL GPU API.

public static TextEngine CreateGPUTextEngine(nint device)

Parameters

device nint

The SDL_GPUDevice to use for creating textures and drawing text.

Returns

TextEngine

Returns a TextEngine object or null on failure; call GetError() for more information.

Remarks

This function should be called on the thread that created the device.

This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Throws on a null device

InvalidOperationException

Throws when failed to create a TextEngine.

See Also
CreateGPUTextEngineWithProperties(int)
DestroyGPUTextEngine(nint)
GetGPUTextDrawData(nint)

CreateGPUTextEngineWithProperties(int)

Create a GPU text engine with custom properties.

public static nint CreateGPUTextEngineWithProperties(int props)

Parameters

props int

A pointer to a set of properties for the text engine.

Returns

nint

Returns a pointer to the created GPU text engine, or null on failure; call GetError() for more information.

Remarks

This function creates a text engine for drawing text with the SDL GPU API, using the specified properties.

This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0.

CreateRendererTextEngine(nint)

Create a text engine for drawing text with the SDL renderer API.

public static TextEngine CreateRendererTextEngine(nint renderer)

Parameters

renderer nint

The SDL_Renderer to use for creating textures and drawing text.

Returns

TextEngine

Returns a TextEngine object or null on failure; call GetError() for more information.

Remarks

This function should be called on the thread that created the renderer.

This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0.

Exceptions

Throws on a null renderer

Throws when failed to create a TextEngine.

This function is available since SDL_ttf 3.0.0.

MixerVersionAtLeast(int, int, int)

Checks if the compiled SDL3_ttf version is at least the specified version.

public static bool MixerVersionAtLeast(int major, int minor, int micro)

Parameters

major int

The major version to check.

minor int

The minor version to check.

micro int

The micro version to check.

Returns

bool

True if the compiled version is at least the specified version; otherwise, false.
